content.description: Start by scrambling up a dirty yet easy slab past one bolt to reach the ledge. This first bolt can be skipped or back-cleaned. From the ledge, you can reach the next bolt. Then, climb a bit higher on the ledge to clip the 3rd bolt, and back-clean the second bolt. I recommend using an extended draw on the 3rd bolt to reduce rope drag. This is where the climb really begins. From the ledge, launch into an overhung boulder problem past a couple more thoughtfully placed bolts. While this is likely the crux, the route isn't over once you pull onto the headwall. The next long section is absolutely wonderful vertical climbing on pinch blobs and slopers, with many engaging sequences throughout. The final brief section before the chains offers a touch of spice. There is a large loose-looking block right before the chains. It is fairly straightforward to avoid this entirely. This is one of the most fun 10's at the crag, enjoy!I recommend bringing 11 draws, one of them being an alpine. This works if you skip the first bolt, use a normal draw on the second, the alpine on the third, and then back-clean the second. Feel free to bring extras if you don't want to worry about skipping or back-cleaning, but then I'd highly recommend extending at least the first three to help with rope drag.
content.location: The farthest left line on the main section of the Quarantine Wall (Heavy In Your Arms is farther left than the main Quarantine Wall), just left of Glad To See You Go.

content.description: A nice adventure up past the tree line. Three distinct sections each with engaging cruxes.  Belay from the ground. Climber accesses the route from the left. Do a v0- boulder problem (or use fixed line) to establish on the ledge and clip high first bolt. To help reduce rope drag consider bumping the first few draws up or unclipping as you go. Tie a knot in your rope! A 70m barely gets you back to the ledge at the first bolt. Untie and carefully down climb from here (or use the fixed line).
content.location: About 25 meters left of the main Quarantine Wall routes beginning in a small tree shaded nook.  Easily identified by the short fixed line.

content.description: Big moves in steep terrain lead to intriguing movement through highly featured vert. Don't get too comfortable, as the wall kicks back again just before easing to less than vertical moves on great rock. Lower off the first set of anchors at 75 ft or fully recover on the low angle ledge and continue up the quality black rock to the higher anchors. Same grade either way. Tie a knot if using a 60m when lowering from upper anchors.
content.location: Between Trip Infatuation and By Myself

content.description: Begins on right side face on an arete-like feature. Lots of variety. Starts with a juggy overhung section which leads into stemming, face climbing with open hand slopers, mantles, and thin face climbing at times.
content.location: Between By Myself and Curbside Stickup, following the face up to the arete-like feature.

content.description: Starting left of a large crack, climb through 4 bolts with interesting features and transition across shallow dihedral to better rock. Continue up through moderate and thoughtful climbing for a few more bolts and prepare for the distinct technical crux at the top. May be a challenging onsight if near your limit. Second and third pitches are closed projects, please do not use the fixed line on the second pitch.
content.location: Farthest right open line at the Quarantine Wall. Starts just left of crack feature and climbs up and right into shallow dihedral.

content.description: Multiple cruxes punctuated by good rests on fantastic features. Lower off the first set of anchors at 75 ft or fully recover on the low angle ledge and continue up the quality black rock to the higher anchors. Same grade either way, but the extension will keep you on your toes. Tie a knot if using a 60m when lowering from the upper anchors. I highly recommend climbing to the upper anchors.
content.protection: Bolts to sport loweroffs. Lower (75 ft) and upper (100 ft) anchors.
content.location: Between Glad To See You Go and Fourteen Days. Third open line from the right on the Quarantine Wall.

content.description: Tall highly featured wall that begins 75 ft right of Bomb Shelter and continues for another 75 ft with highly featured steep section at the base. If approaching from the right, this is about 300 ft left of the Studio
